data.title: Abandon buildings
data.body:
This was originally an idea by @Microbit, but he is too shy to post it, so I am taking the job over :)

It could be interesting to be able to drop a building, to abandon it.

There could be a new button at the top of the screen (near the beacon, sell, repair, energy buttons) to perform this action.

The player would just have to click on this button, then click on a building and it would switch from being the player's building to a "neutral" one, making it capturable for his mates (and enemies).

And the only way to reverse that process would be capture it with an engineer.
Note that it would only be possible to abandon buildings (not units).

Also note that to capture an advanced building, the player would need first to have the required tech-tree. A player with a really simple base (refinery+infantry) couldn't capture nuke silos or helipads for example.

 **Usefulness**
- your pal loses his refinery... you can give him one of yours.
- sometimes, during a battle, when you lose many important buildings (after a nuke attack), it takes a long time for you to re-create your base. With this feature, a player could retrieve a missing building for his base (as long as he has an engineer on the field).
- you are low money... but you have an engineer idling outside. With this feature, you could capture one of your team-mate's silos and get some of the money it contains.
- you could capture your pal's power-plants too (useful if you are low on energy).
- you could "share" oil derricks...

Team-mates are in the same team after all, to me, the goal is to help each other too. Not building our bases on our owns.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2821292-abandon-buildings?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add a progress bar to replay viewer
data.body: Even though it's only a visual feature and you can't rewind, it would still be helpful to show how long the game took and at which point you currently are. Right now the duration of the replay is not shown in game and when it ends there is no indication, it just stops.

data.title: Allied Paratanks
data.body: I think there is a balance problem in special weapons. Soviets have 2(Spy Plane, Paratrooper,) Allieds have 1(GPS) special weapons. I added Paratanks to allieds. But icon is missing(same as paratrooper) also soviet paratroopers are now more powerful.

data.title: Parabombs - RA
data.body: OpenRA isn't using them and i know it's reason. "Balance". But i think why don't we add it for allies. Soviets have 2(Spy Plane, Paradrop) but allies have 1 (GPS) special weapon without super weapons now.

data.title: Properly save replay even when the game crashes (fixes #5610)
data.body:
I simply wrapped the run loop and the orderManager disposal in a try/finally block. The rest is whitespace changes; [add ?w=1 to the url to ignore whitespace](https://github.com/pavlos256/OpenRA/commit/e19dae8eeca66d72a5d1efbab6803bcdb70b9377?w=1).

I tested it before and after using the new /crash command.

data.title: Implementation Request: Trait FreeActorPeriodic
data.body:
Essentially FreeActor trait with extended functionality. Calls itself periodically, each time creating a new free actor.

```
[Desc("Player periodically receives a unit for free. This also works for structures.",
        "You can have multiples of this trait by assigning IDs like FreeActorPeriodic@2, ...")]
FreeActorPeriodicInfo

[Desc("Name of actor")]
string Actor = null;

[Desc("What the unit should start doing. Warning: If this is not a harvester", "it will break if you use FindResources.")]
string InitialActivity = null;

[Desc("Offset relative to actor-center in 2D (e.g. 1, 2)","Actor will be placed as close as possible")]
int2 SpawnOffset = int2.Zero;

[Desc("Which direction the free actor should face.")]
int Facing = 0;
```

Immediate uses of this trait would include combining it with the TimedLife requested trait, ThrowsShrapnel and resource splattering to make d2k spice blooms periodically spawn an invisible actor that immediately dies and sprays spice around the area (as per original d2k).

data.title: Implementation Request: Trait TimedLife
data.body:
Trait that automatically kills or removes the actor after the specified amount of ticks.

```
[Desc("Kills the actor after the specified number of ticks.")]
TimedLIfeInfo

[Desc("Number of ticks until the actor is killed.")]
int LifeTicks = 1; /* Default is immediately (will tick at least once). */

[Desc("Should the actor be silently removed from the world instead of being killed?")]
bool RemoveInstead = false; /* False uses Actor.Kill, true uses World.Remove */
```

data.title: Crashes when installing RA
data.body:
I have installed openRA, and have opened it, and selected Red Alert. I am then asked to either download RA or to use a CD.
I own RA and have a fully working CD. However, when I try to use the CD, openRA says installation failed (while it is trying to find redalert.mix). I have tried all the RA cds I have, but nothing helps.

If, on the other hand, I choose to download RA, it downloads it, but once it reaches 100% it immediately crashes. The crash log says 
Exception of type `System.UnauthorizedAccessException`: Access to the path 'C:\Users\Adam\Documents\OpenRA\Content\ra\redalert.mix' is denied.
I tried running openRA as an admin. I have tried restarting the computer. Neither of those help. The folder exists, and has redalert.mix in it. I can see the file and even rename it if I want, so windows has no trouble accessing this file, only openRA does.

So neither option for installing the RA files works for me. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

I have Windows 7, 64bit.
